docs.title: Kenan Banal
docs.text:
Notes

Thank you for check out my website. Check out the table of content at the top left or search for anything at the top right part of the website.

Website in Progress

This site is currently under development. Some sections may be incomplete, and content will be updated regularly. Thank you!

docs.title: Resume
docs.text: Kenan Banal makes things that he is passionate about such which mostly involve software and hardware technologies.

docs.title: De La Salle University
docs.text: Sept 2021 — Dec 2025 Bachelor of Science in Computer Engineering CGPA: 3.0 / 4.0

docs.title: La Salle Green Hills
docs.text: Sept 2020 — May 2021 High School Diploma — With High Honors

docs.title: Technology Specialist Intern — La Salle Green Hills
docs.text:
May 2025 — Aug 2025

  • Given a task to program a student makeup slip for absent student for an improved seemless processing of absence slips.
  • Tech stack used were PHP, MySQL, Apache, MariaDB as seen on my GitHub.
  • Assigned to manage and assemble the Bambu Lab 3D printers and VR headsets.

docs.title: Committee Officer — Association of Computer Engineering Students
docs.text:
Jan 2024 — Aug 2025

  • Assigned project head in the "The Art of Programming Design Patterns"
  • Involved in managing events, coordinated logistics, and developed reviewer materials

docs.title: Carabao Mango Sorter & Grader with Machine Learning
docs.text: • Built an automated Carabao mango grader and sorter using Machine Learning, Raspberry Pi, and Conveyor Belts. Trained and tested the pretrained machine learning model for the image acquisition system

docs.title: Documentation Website
docs.text:
• Created a static documentation website containing my resume and other necessary information to compile all my projects.
  • Code with Material for MkDocs

docs.title: Text-Based Task Manager
docs.text:
• Shell-script-based task manager for Ubuntu Linux.
  • Presented the results at an IEEE conference named Human-Computer Interaction and Emerging Media (HCIEM) 2024.

docs.title: Traffic Light PCB
docs.text:
• Designed an existing circuit on Autodesk EAGLE while physically etching and soldering the electrical components
  • Testing of the schematic was done on Multisim

docs.title: Student Portfolio
docs.text: • Written a full stack frontend website using multiple frameworks such as React, AJAX, Bootstrap, and jQuery.

docs.title: Technologies I Like
docs.text:
Languages: Python · Java · C · PHP · MySQL · JavaScript · React · LaTeX

Developer Tools: Git · VS Code · Neovim · Tmux · Linux

Frameworks & Libraries: React · Material for MkDocs · Bootstrap · Node.js · PyTorch

Hardware Designer Tools: Logisim Evolution · Multisim · Proteus

Microcontroller: Raspberry Pi · ESP32 · NodeMCU · Arduino

docs.title: Thesis Paper
docs.text: Our group's thesis paper is about Grading and Sorting Carabao Mangoes using Machine Learning. We did this by getting training and testing our selected CNN model for classifying the ripeness and bruises. We also used computer vision techniques such as OpenCV and thresholding to get the size of the mango. -

docs.title: This was one of the most unique projects me and my group members have made but also one of the most challenging given the time constrain and our group's first time etching PCB (Printed Circuit Boards).
Shown above is the existing circuit taken from the internet but was still drawn and tested on Multisim as shown below  -
